intro: Nitidocidium gracile, commonly known as the slender nitidocidium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. Its flowers are usually pale pink or white, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Nitidocidium gracile is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its elegant appearance and ease of care.
